Jackson_Dean:
{{Short description|American singer and songwriter}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Jackson Dean | image = | image_upright = | image_size = | landscape = yes | alt = | birth_name = Jackson Dean Nicholson | birth_date = {{birth date and age|2000|10|06}}{{cite web|url=https://countrynow.com/jackson-dean-earns-first-ever-no-1-single-with-dont-come-lookin-its-hard-to-wrap-my-head-around/|title=Jackson Dean Earns First-Ever No.1 Single With 'Don't Come Lookin": 'It's Hard To Wrap My Head Around'|last=Black|first=Lauren Jo|date=November 29, 2022|access-date=December 5, 2022|work=Country Now}} | birth_place = [[Odenton, Maryland]], U.S. | origin = [[Nashville, Tennessee]], U.S. | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter | instrument = Vocals | years_active = 2018–present | label = [[Big Machine Records|Big Machine]] | website = https://www.jacksondeanmusic.com/ }} '''Jackson Dean Nicholson''' (born October 6, 2000) is an American [[country music]] singer and songwriter. He signed to [[Big Machine Records]] in 2021 and has charted with the singles "[[Don't Come Lookin']]" and "Fearless (The Echo)". ==Biography== Dean was born in [[Odenton, Maryland]]. He left his hometown at age 18 to begin songwriting, which led to collaborations with [[Casey Beathard]] and Luke Dick. After serving as an opening act for [[Kane Brown]], [[Jake Owen]], and [[Brothers Osborne]], he was signed to [[Big Machine Records]] in 2021.{{cite web | url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/jackson-dean-mn0003569404/biography | title=Jackson Dean biography | publisher=AllMusic | accessdate=April 19, 2022}} Dean's first release for Big Machine was a self-titled [[extended play]] with the single "Wings", the former of which was released on April 16, 2021.{{cite web | url=https://musicrow.com/2021/04/jackson-dean-announces-debut-project-on-big-machine-records/ | title=Jackson Dean Announces Debut Project On Big Machine Records | publisher=MusicRow | date=April 16, 2021 | accessdate=April 19, 2022}} Dean's debut single, "[[Don't Come Lookin']]", was released in February 2022, followed by his debut album, ''Greenbroke'', on March 11, 2022. In addition, he was booked as an opening act for [[Brooks & Dunn]]'s Reboot 2022 Tour.{{cite web | url=https://tasteofcountry.com/jackson-dean-greenbroke-debut-album-dont-come-looking/ | title=Jackson Dean Announces Debut Album, Shares First Single | publisher=[[Taste of Country]] | date=February 28, 2022 | accessdate=April 19, 2022 | author=Carena Liptak}} "Don't Come Lookin'" peaked at number three on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Country Airplay]] chart in November. The song was also featured in an episode of the [[Paramount Network]] TV series ''[[Yellowstone (American TV series)|Yellowstone]]''. "Fearless (The Echo)" was released as the second single from ''Greenbroke'' in 2023, and it reached a peak of number 11 on the ''Billboard'' Country Airplay chart in 2024. Dean's second studio album, ''On the Back of My Dreams'', will be released on September 6, 2024.{{cite web|url=https://americansongwriter.com/jackson-dean-announces-sophomore-studio-album-on-back-dreams-new-single-heavens-betsy/|title=Jackson Dean Announces Sophomore Studio Album 'On the Back of My Dreams' with New Single "Heavens to Betsy"|author=Clayton Edwards|date=August 2, 2024|website=American Songwriter|access-date=August 2, 2024}} Its lead single, "Heavens to Betsy", was released in August 2024.{{cite web|url=https://assets.countryaircheck.com/public/0c45c46f-2b9a-440e-9c58e60e885345d1/Issue-920-July-29-2024.pdf|title=Country Aircheck Weekly July 29, 2024, Issue 920|date=July 29, 2024|website=Country Aircheck|accessdate=July 30, 2024}} ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! style="width:14em;"| Title ! style="width:20em;"| Album details |- ! scope="row"| ''Greenbroke'' | * Release date: March 11, 2022 * Label: [[Big Machine Records|Big Machine]] |- ! scope="row"| ''On the Back of My Dreams'' | * Release date: September 6, 2024 * Label: Big Machine |} ===Extended plays=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! style="width:12em;"| Title ! style="width:20em;"| EP details |- ! scope="row"| ''Jackson Dean'' | * Release date: April 16, 2021 * Label: Big Machine |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:14em;"| Single ! colspan="5"| Peak chart positions ! rowspan="2"| [[List of music recording certifications|Certifications]] ! rowspan="2"| Album |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! width="45"| [[Billboard Hot 100|US]]

{{cite magazine|url=http://bulletins.billboard.com/country/country_update_2024_0920.pdf|title=Billboard Country Update|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=September 20, 2024|access-date=September 21, 2024}} | — | — | | ''On the Back of My Dreams'' |} == Awards and nominations == {| class="wikitable" !Year !Organization !Award !Nominee/Work !Result |- |2023 |[[Academy of Country Music Awards]] |[[Academy of Country Music Award for New Male Artist of the Year|New Male Artist of the Year]] |Jackson Dean |{{nom}} |} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dean, Jackson}} [[Category:American country singer-songwriters]] [[Category:Big Machine Records artists]] [[Category:Country musicians from Maryland]] [[Category:Date of birth unknown]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Odenton, Maryland]] [[Category:2000 births]]
